avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered in the persistent weak layer in isolated cases above about 2400m on very steep shady slopes. These releases usually are small-sized. The risks of injuries from being forced to take a fall outweigh those of being buried in snow masses. As a result of daytime warming and solar radiation, isolated, generally small-sized glide-snow avalanches are still possible on steep smooth slopes which have not yet discharged. Glide cracks are signals of possibly imminent danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated avalanche prone locations in persistent weak layer. Isolated glide-snow avalanches.

snowpackStructure.comment: During a night of star-studded skies during which outgoing radiation will function to perfection, a breakable-to-capable of bearing loads crust can be generated once again. During the course of the day, it softens up particularly on sunny slopes and at lower altitudes. On shady high-altitude slopes above 2400m, isolated weak layers occur inside the snowpack.

tendency.highlights: As a result of foehn winds in the southern regions on Tuesday, heavily clouded skies, little sunshine. Ongoing low avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.comment: Sunshine will be dominant into the afternoon, then widespread clouds will move in from the south. Temperatures will quite mild, due to foehn impact. At 2000m: +6 degrees. Moderate (in high alpine regions gradually brisk-velocity) southwesterly winds.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a result of daytime warming and solar radiation, isolated small-sized glide-snow avalanches are still possible on steep, smooth slopes which have not yet discharged. Glide cracks are signals of potential imminent danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Not much snow. Low avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: During a night of star-studded skies during which outgoing radiation will function to perfection, a breakable-to-capable of bearing loads crust can be generated once again. During the course of the day, it softens up particularly on sunny slopes and at lower altitudes. On south-facing slopes the ground is becoming bare of snow up to high altitudes.

tendency.highlights: Intermittent sunshine on Tuesday due to foehn wind influence. Ongoing low avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.comment: Sunshine will be dominant into the afternoon, then widespread clouds will move in from the south. Temperatures will quite mild, due to foehn impact. At 2000m: +6 degrees. Moderate (in high alpine regions gradually brisk-velocity) southwesterly winds.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Predominantly low avalanche danger. Caution urged on very steep shady slopes in high alpine regions.
